name: ThoughtSpot
slogan: Analytics without the hassle, get everything you need for the comfort of your hand
description:
ThoughtSpot is disrupting the BI industry with search-driven analytics for the enterprise. ThoughtSpot's Relational Search technology lets business people analyze company data in seconds and helps BI & Analytics teams cut their reporting backlogs by over 90%. ThoughtSpot connects with data from on-premise and cloud data sources and is designed for enterprise-scale, security, and governance - all while deploying 85% faster than legacy technologies. ThoughtSpot has built the world's most advanced, yet easy-to-use number-crunching machine with a singular mission - to deliver access to data at "human scale. 

The company's founding team has previously built market-defining search and analytics technologies at Google, Amazon, Oracle and Microsoft. For more information please visit www.thoughtspot.com.

jobs.title: Customer Success Manager - Minnesota
jobs.description:
Are you looking to join one of the fastest growing analytics companies in the world? Our mission is to help make the world more fact-driven by making analytics as easy as your favorite app. With ThoughtSpot it’s 1000x easier for anyone to find insights hidden in their company data in seconds.

We are looking for a qualified Customer Success Managers (CSM)  to drive adoption and success within a portfolio of top tier customer accounts. You will drive business value and outcomes for them by bringing ThoughtSpot’s product and services in concert with their strategic business goals.

**What you'll be doing at ThoughtSpot**

- Part of an Account team that manages 1-5 enterprise accounts consisting of Fortune 10 and Fortune 50 companies and responsible for Annual Recurring Revenue of ~$3 MM.
- Be a primary point of contact for customers and be the voice that communicates use case/requirements/expectations in a way that is actionable for Marketing, Sales, Support, Services, and Product teams at ThoughtSpot.
- Understanding how our customers want to use ThoughtSpot and helping make those aspirations a reality: Be the companion on their journey from on boarding, adoption and a lifetime of success.
- Customer relationship management - building the bridge between human and data that is the sweet spot for customer success
- Learning the technical nuances of customers’ configuration and act as initial layer of support and guidance
- Collaborate across ThoughtSpot departments and customize the response to the needs of our customers
- Understand the concepts and importance of identifying growth areas in existing customer base - Helping build expansion opportunities - passive selling

**Required experiences and skills**

- You consider yourself a “technologist” that can “talk to the business”
- Want to “roll-up-your-sleeves” when a customer has an issue and help do initial triage or resolution when needed
- Leveraging your knowledge to help customers get over technical hurdles while expanding their use of the  platform
- 5+ years in customer facing roles - Sales/Support/Services/Architecture, with at least some account management experience/customer-facing
- Escalation management and strong project management fundamentals
- Passionate about building customer success "Brand" - Being a difference maker
- DNA - You possess the “Helper Gene” and are proactive in acting on behalf of your customers

 

**Having these will set you apart as a candidate (Looking for a strong mixture)**

- You have hands-on experience with data warehousing ecosystems (e.g. Data sources / ETL / Data warehouse / Data marts). Understanding of different types of schemas (OLTP vs. OLAP, snowflake, etc.)
- You have hands-on experience with Data and Analytics tools such as Business Objects, Cognos, OBIEE, Microstrategy, Tableau, Qlik, PowerB, SQL
- Familiarity with ETL tools (such as Alteryx, Datameer, Informatica, Talend, SSIS, DataStage, Kettle) is a plus
- Knowledge and experience with deployment architectures on-premises and in cloud environments like AWS, Azure and Google Cloud
- You are not afraid of travel and want to build long-lasting personal relationships with our customers 
- You like the start-up environment and can wear your hat in any direction
- Documentation and process are important to you; you want to help build the foundation for our customer success management team
- You LOVE technology and want to learn all about next generation analytics in the enterprise
- You can’t stop smiling when your favorite customer volunteers to pen a customer story
- Superb ability to build rapport with customers and to represent their best interests

 

The world's most innovative enterprises use ThoughtSpot to empower every person in their organization, from C-suite executive to front-line employee, with the ability to quickly uncover data-driven insights. With ThoughtSpot, business people can type a simple Google-like search to instantly analyze billions of rows of data, and leverage artificial intelligence to get trusted, relevant insights pushed to them as answers to thousands of questions they might not have thought to ask. ThoughtSpot is simple enough for any business person to use, yet powerful enough to handle even the largest, most complex enterprise data without sacrificing speed, security, or governance. That’s why customers like Walmart, 7-11, BT, Celebrity Cruises, Daimler, De Beers, Hulu, Mayo Clinic, Nationwide Building Society, and ScotiaBank have turned to ThoughtSpot to transform their decision-making cultures. By making insights a part of every conversation and every decision, ThoughtSpot is reimagining the role of data in creating a more fact-driven world. 

For more information please visit[ thoughtspot.com](http://thoughtspot.com).

  • Escalation management and strong project management fundamentals
  • Passionate about building customer success "Brand" - Being a difference maker
  • DNA - You possess the “Helper Gene” and are proactive in acting on behalf of your customers

Having these will set you apart as a candidate (Looking for a strong mixture)

  • You have hands-on experience with data warehousing ecosystems (e.g. Data sources / ETL / Data warehouse / Data marts). Understanding of different types of schemas (OLTP vs. OLAP, snowflake, etc.)
  • You have hands-on experience with Data and Analytics tools such as Business Objects, Cognos, OBIEE, Microstrategy, Tableau, Qlik, PowerB, SQL
  • Familiarity with ETL tools (such as Alteryx, Datameer, Informatica, Talend, SSIS, DataStage, Kettle) is a plus
  • Knowledge and experience with deployment architectures on-premises and in cloud environments like AWS, Azure and Google Cloud
  • You are not afraid of travel and want to build long-lasting personal relationships with our customers
  • You like the start-up environment and can wear your hat in any direction
  • Documentation and process are important to you; you want to help build the foundation for our customer success management team
  • You LOVE technology and want to learn all about next generation analytics in the enterprise
  • You can’t stop smiling when your favorite customer volunteers to pen a customer story
  • Superb ability to build rapport with customers and to represent their best interests

The world's most innovative enterprises use ThoughtSpot to empower every person in their organization, from C-suite executive to front-line employee, with the ability to quickly uncover data-driven insights. With ThoughtSpot, business people can type a simple Google-like search to instantly analyze billions of rows of data, and leverage artificial intelligence to get trusted, relevant insights pushed to them as answers to thousands of questions they might not have thought to ask. ThoughtSpot is simple enough for any business person to use, yet powerful enough to handle even the largest, most complex enterprise data without sacrificing speed, security, or governance. That’s why customers like Walmart, 7-11, BT, Celebrity Cruises, Daimler, De Beers, Hulu, Mayo Clinic, Nationwide Building Society, and ScotiaBank have turned to ThoughtSpot to transform their decision-making cultures. By making insights a part of every conversation and every decision, ThoughtSpot is reimagining the role of data in creating a more fact-driven world.

For more information please visit thoughtspot.com.

jobs.title: Director of Engineering - Frontend
jobs.description:
**What do we do?**

ThoughtSpot is on a mission to create a more fact-driven world. Our platform is disrupting the $200B+ analytics market industry by making it 1000x faster and easier for non-technical business people to answer their own data questions, based on innovations in search engines, in-memory large-scale computing & AI technology. With ThoughtSpot, anyone from C-suite executives to front-line employees can use a simple search to instantly analyze billions of rows of data, and leverage artificial intelligence to get relevant insights on questions they might not have thought to ask. If you’re looking to solve hard problems in a large market, this is the role for you!

**Your mission, should you choose to accept it:**

- Recruit and build world-class engineering teams with diversity of thought. Develop and grow leaders to continue pushing the boundaries of engineering excellence and execution
- Collaborate closely with other functions and teams, to continue innovating in user experience and building best-in-class software systems powering them
- Help evolve a culture of selfless excellence in which each person does the best work of their lives and amplifies everyone around them
- Lead technical direction, quality and execution for the application layer at Thoughtspot.

**You know you are the right person, if you:**

- Are an engineer at heart and crave putting imagination in action. You likely have 15+ years of experience crafting world-class products and building robust, high performance and intelligent systems for them
- Have expertise in one or more areas like building and scaling web apps, UI Engineering, Information Visualization, Machine Learning etc.
- Have provided senior technical leadership at the highest levels in a strong engineering culture. Your team members are thankful to you for their impact and growth as engineers and leaders.
- Love building and leading exceptional teams in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment. You have a strong bias for action and being resourceful
- Are obsessed with customer experience and uncompromising engineering standards

**How are we doing?**

With Fortune 500 customers in every industry, such as Walmart, Hulu, Daimler, 7Eleven, and Rolls Royce, ThoughtSpot has become one of the fastest growing analytics companies in the world, growing a triple digits year over year. The company recently raised $248M at a $1.95B valuation, joined the leaders quadrant in the Gartner MQ, was named one of the 50 top startups in the world by LinkedIn, and a technology pioneer by the World Economic Forum.

**Why do engineering at ThoughtSpot?**

We are an engineering driven organization co-founded by engineers who built search and infrastructure systems at Google, database systems at Microsoft and enterprise software at Oracle. As an engineer, you can learn how to build distributed systems, and the engineering processes/best practices to ship software that solves a problem.

 

At ThoughtSpot, you have the ownership and responsibility to take charge and accelerate your career that comes with a scaling company, while having the opportunity to build deeper expertise in an early stage startup. You’ll work alongside experts in product, design, sales and customer success, giving you the time and energy to  focus on engineering. You’ll also get the chance to be part of a truly globally distributed engineering team - more than 50% of our global engineering output is driven from the Bangalore office. Some teams collaborate closely with counterparts in Sunnyvale and Seattle, while others run independently from Bangalore. 

**Diversity & Inclusion:**

We are very deliberate about building a culture focused on #BalanceforBetter, where everyone is seen, heard, and most importantly, valued.

At ThoughtSpot, we know a diverse and inclusive workforce ultimately drives innovation. Multiple voices lead to new ideas, encourage out-of-the box thinking, and create new opportunities. ThoughtSpot’s mission is to “create a more fact-driven world for every human.” This mission itself demands inclusion - reaching every human is only possible through a variety of perspectives, approaches, and ideas.

If the above sounds exciting (and challenging!), please reach out to us, We’d love to talk.

jobs.title: Director, Partner Sales
jobs.description:
**Are you looking to join one of the fastest growing software companies in the Bay Area? ThoughtSpot’s Search & AI-Driven analytics platform is revolutionizing how the world uses data by making analytics 1000x faster and easier for non-technical business people. ThoughtSpot was recently named a Leader in Gartner's 2019 Magic Quadrant for Analytics. ThoughtSpot is the first new Leader in the past six year and is the fastest analytics company ever to become a Leader.**

The Director of Partner Sales will define and execute the partner strategy for your assigned region with a clear goal on revenue with and through partners; encompassing Advisory partners, Consulting and Services Partners (SIs), Channel Partners and in-region Technology & Services partners. These partners are key for the ThoughtSpot North America GTM to drive demand, influence, co-sell, deliver and manage ThoughtSpot customers. 

The ideal candidate has a business background that enables them engage at the CXO level, a sales background that enables them to easily interact with enterprise customers and field sales reps, and an understanding of alliance and channel business models. You should have a demonstrated ability to think strategically about business, product, and technical challenges, and the ability to build and convey compelling value propositions.

**Responsibilities:**

- Iterate ThoughtSpot’s North America Partner Sales Strategy

  - Working internally with relevant stakeholder groups and externally with potential partners, continue to develop the NA Partner strategy that truly leads to incremental value for both ThoughtSpot and the Partner(s).
- Continue driving and developing key, existing partnerships and their sales pipeline in NA with a focus on partners enabling sales and GTM for ThoughtSpot NA - the focus is on Alliances & SI partnerships
- Define, Prioritize, Recruit, Onboard and Manage NA Partners as the business dictates

  - Build bilateral executive partner relationships to support field engagement
  - Enable the building of the relationships between ThoughtSpot sales and the partner sales teams in a consistent fashion - this is outside of engagements driven by customer opportunity or events 
  - Drive account mapping, account planning and support on deal-level engagements
  - Build GTM / Business plans with key partners; to define functional requirements (train, market, sell, support, renew), investments and measure the progress of the joint partnership GTM in a regular cadence
  - Track pipeline and progress with the Partner and the Thoughtspot field and drive engagement where needed to close and uncover new opportunity 
  - Manage any escalations as to the partnership or deal engagement in the field
  - Hold regular QBRs, using business plans, to measure alignment and progress
  - Manage Partner pipeline, sales status and report in regular cadence to country, regional and global partner leadership
- Working with internal groups such as Training / Education, Pre-Sales, Sales Ops, Support, Customer Success, Finance, Legal, Partner Programs; communicate, build and execute on internal processes & programs in support of Japan partners
- This role will start off as an individual contributor

**Required Skills/Qualifications:**  

- 10+ years of Partner Management experience at a Software firm which has sold primarily to Line-of Business (as opposed to IT)
- Experience building and maintaining partner ecosystems with a focus on SIs, Service Providers and Management Consultants
- Experience delivering partner programs across multiple stakeholders such as the Partner, Education, Sales, Professional Services and Customer / Partner Success
- Enterprise Software Sales or Channel Sales experience
- Management/Team Lead experience preferred

**Preferred Qualifications**

- Experience building new Channel ecosystems
- Experience working within the enterprise software industry
- 2+ years experience working in the territory
- Expertise in creating multiple go-to-market models such as resale, OEM, co-sell & co-market, across subscription and perpetual license models
- Experience building Enablement programs for partners
- Enterprise Software Sales experience
- Management/Team Lead experience
- MS or MBA preferred

**About ThoughtSpot**    

At ThoughtSpot, we solve some of the hardest, most challenging problems in technology. The kind of problems we solve require diverse perspectives and the team-spirit to see those differences as opportunities rather than roadblocks. It’s why diversity isn’t a box to check; it’s the heart of “Selfless Excellence,” our core value we live every day. To make our dent in the universe, we seek employees with unique identities, backgrounds, and perspectives that want to build an inclusive, respectful company culture and truly challenge the status quo.

We support our employees with great benefits like 100% company paid medical/dental/vision/life coverage for employees and dependents, equity in a late stage startup backed by top-tier VCs, conveniently located Palo Alto office with onsite gym, company-provided catered lunch and dinner, and paid holidays and flexible paid time off.

ThoughtSpot’s Search & AI-Driven analytics platform puts the power of a thousand analysts in every business person's hands. With ThoughtSpot’s next-generation analytics platform, business people can use Google-like search to easily analyze complex, large-scale enterprise data and get trusted insights to questions they didn’t know to ask, automatically - all with a single click. ThoughtSpot’s customers include the world’s largest companies, such as Amway, BT, Bed Bath and Beyond, Chevron Federal Credit Union, De Beers, JD Sports, PetCo, ServiceNow, and Scotiabank.

ThoughtSpot is helmed by CEO Sudheesh Nair after being  co-founded in 2012 by Ajeet Singh and technical co-founders from Google, Microsoft, Amazon, and Oracle. Backed by investors Lightspeed Venture Partners, Khosla Ventures, General Catalyst Partners, Geodesic Capital and Capital One Growth Ventures, ThoughtSpot has raised over $305 million to date at a unicorn valuation. Join us in our mission of enabling  analytics "human scale" by putting search and AI-driven analytics in the hands of 20 million users by 2020. 

**For more information please visit** [**thoughtspot.com**](http://thoughtspot.com/) **.**

    • Enable the building of the relationships between ThoughtSpot sales and the partner sales teams in a consistent fashion - this is outside of engagements driven by customer opportunity or events
    • Drive account mapping, account planning and support on deal-level engagements
    • Build GTM / Business plans with key partners; to define functional requirements (train, market, sell, support, renew), investments and measure the progress of the joint partnership GTM in a regular cadence
    • Track pipeline and progress with the Partner and the Thoughtspot field and drive engagement where needed to close and uncover new opportunity
    • Manage any escalations as to the partnership or deal engagement in the field
    • Hold regular QBRs, using business plans, to measure alignment and progress
    • Manage Partner pipeline, sales status and report in regular cadence to country, regional and global partner leadership

  • Working with internal groups such as Training / Education, Pre-Sales, Sales Ops, Support, Customer Success, Finance, Legal, Partner Programs; communicate, build and execute on internal processes & programs in support of Japan partners

  • This role will start off as an individual contributor

Required Skills/Qualifications:

  • 10+ years of Partner Management experience at a Software firm which has sold primarily to Line-of Business (as opposed to IT)
  • Experience building and maintaining partner ecosystems with a focus on SIs, Service Providers and Management Consultants
  • Experience delivering partner programs across multiple stakeholders such as the Partner, Education, Sales, Professional Services and Customer / Partner Success
  • Enterprise Software Sales or Channel Sales experience
  • Management/Team Lead experience preferred

Preferred Qualifications

  • Experience building new Channel ecosystems
  • Experience working within the enterprise software industry
  • 2+ years experience working in the territory
  • Expertise in creating multiple go-to-market models such as resale, OEM, co-sell & co-market, across subscription and perpetual license models
  • Experience building Enablement programs for partners
  • Enterprise Software Sales experience
  • Management/Team Lead experience
  • MS or MBA preferred

About ThoughtSpot

At ThoughtSpot, we solve some of the hardest, most challenging problems in technology. The kind of problems we solve require diverse perspectives and the team-spirit to see those differences as opportunities rather than roadblocks. It’s why diversity isn’t a box to check; it’s the heart of “Selfless Excellence,” our core value we live every day. To make our dent in the universe, we seek employees with unique identities, backgrounds, and perspectives that want to build an inclusive, respectful company culture and truly challenge the status quo.

We support our employees with great benefits like 100% company paid medical/dental/vision/life coverage for employees and dependents, equity in a late stage startup backed by top-tier VCs, conveniently located Palo Alto office with onsite gym, company-provided catered lunch and dinner, and paid holidays and flexible paid time off.

ThoughtSpot’s Search & AI-Driven analytics platform puts the power of a thousand analysts in every business person's hands. With ThoughtSpot’s next-generation analytics platform, business people can use Google-like search to easily analyze complex, large-scale enterprise data and get trusted insights to questions they didn’t know to ask, automatically - all with a single click. ThoughtSpot’s customers include the world’s largest companies, such as Amway, BT, Bed Bath and Beyond, Chevron Federal Credit Union, De Beers, JD Sports, PetCo, ServiceNow, and Scotiabank.

ThoughtSpot is helmed by CEO Sudheesh Nair after being co-founded in 2012 by Ajeet Singh and technical co-founders from Google, Microsoft, Amazon, and Oracle. Backed by investors Lightspeed Venture Partners, Khosla Ventures, General Catalyst Partners, Geodesic Capital and Capital One Growth Ventures, ThoughtSpot has raised over $305 million to date at a unicorn valuation. Join us in our mission of enabling analytics "human scale" by putting search and AI-driven analytics in the hands of 20 million users by 2020.

For more information please visit thoughtspot.com .

jobs.title: Product Enablement Intern
jobs.description:
**Are you looking to join one of the fastest growing software companies in the Bay Area? ThoughtSpot’s Search & AI-Driven analytics platform is revolutionizing how the world uses data by making analytics 1000x faster and easier for non-technical business people. ThoughtSpot was recently named a Leader in Gartner's 2019 Magic Quadrant for Analytics. ThoughtSpot is the first new Leader in the past six year and is the fastest analytics company ever to become a Leader.**

Spend your Summer in beautiful Sunnyvale, California, learning and helping our rapidly growing team to attain our full potential! Product Enablement builds innovative experiences to make learning ThoughtSpot exciting, fun, and fast. You will contribute to helping new team members and customers learn how to set up and use ThoughtSpot. If you like writing, graphic design, making videos, or any other aspect of making serious learning an enjoyable and rewarding experience, this opportunity is for you.

**Responsibilities** :

- Assist with writing topics and instructions for using new features.
- Format existing documentation topics to comply with content templates, and identify content for reuse across product components.
- Integrate feedback from the field, and monitor internal channels for possible content improvements.
- Contribute to the strategy for on-boarding new users, ongoing technical learning, and employee development.
- Help design, develop, and deliver technical information and courses, including course materials, exercises, and skill evaluations.
- Edit video of internal information sessions, making it accessible to users across the organization.
- Monitor course completion and prepare reports for internal stakeholders.
- Create assessments and certifications to ensure readiness for team members and success for customers.

**Required Skills/Qualifications:**

- University-level student, pursuing a Bachelor’s degree with a focus in Communications, English, Instructional Design, Technical Writing, Journalism, Information Management, or a related discipline.
- Enthusiasm for creating documentation and new learning experiences.
- Excellent presentation, written, and oral communication skills.
- Familiarity with adult learning principles and course design techniques.
- Knowledge of database and/or business intelligence solutions is a strong plus.

jobs.title: Sales Development Manager
jobs.description:
**Are you looking to help join one of the fastest-growing software companies in the world & a 2-time Gartner Magic Quadrant Leader? Do you want to help disrupt a multi-billion dollar industry? ThoughtSpot’s Search & AI-Driven analytics platform is disrupting the BI industry by making analytics 1000x faster and easier for non-technical business people.**

We currently have an exciting role for an experienced Sales Development Manager who will provide leadership to an existing team in London and prepare for our next phase of company growth. He/she will lead from the front in demonstrating company values to create a high-performance, high-energy team. The ideal candidate will embody and utilize a variety of strategies and tactics that will drive results and develop bench strength for further expansion opportunities in the future.

**Responsibilities **
- Hire, train and ultimately promote a team of "A" players.
- Lead a growth-focused organization through regular training sessions, personal development plans and sharing of internal/external best practices.
- Manage performance by providing ongoing training and coaching against KPIs.
- Create, develop and execute account penetration strategies that get Thoughtspots technology seen by key prospects and decision-makers.
- Manage and track performance and operational goals for the Sales Development team.
- Review daily/weekly/monthly goals with Director of Inside Sales, field RVPs and SVP of Global Business Operations.
- Closely monitor Inbound MQL treatment to ensure best in class conversions.
- Overall responsibility for inbound/outbound prospecting excellence via phone, email, & social channels.
- Ownership of optimization of results and customer experience.
- Develop sales incentives and SDR performance programs as needed to hit business objectives.
- Ensure processes, procedures and policies are followed to ensure results are comprised of quantity AND quality Oversees the communication of sales activities to key stakeholders on performance relative to company growth expectations.
- Monitor call handling and trends to maximize effectiveness in delivering our value prop and filling the sales funnel.
- Partner with the Sales Operations team to develop new dashboards and reporting insights to drive a better understanding of the underlying business performance.
- Staying close to the data, numbers, and performance is critical to success.

**Required skills & Qualifications**

- 2-3 years as a top-performing Sales Development or Inside Sales rep.
- You need to have demonstrated success in doing the job and coach others how to do it effectively.
- 2-3 years as a top-performing Sales Development or Inside Sales Leader.
- You need to show the ability to start strong on Day 1 with best practices, strategies, and tactics.
- Strong knowledge of account-based sales & marketing strategies.
- Expert use of Salesforce.com and Outreach or Salesloft.
- Familiarity with Gong, DiscoverOrg, and People.AI preferred but not mandatory.
- Innate ability to build relationships with all internal stakeholders to drive mutual success (field sales, marketing, operations, etc).
- University degree strongly preferred.

**About ThoughtSpot**

At ThoughtSpot, we solve some of the hardest, most challenging problems in technology. The kind of problems we solve require diverse perspectives and the team-spirit to see those differences as opportunities rather than roadblocks. It’s why diversity isn’t a box to check; it’s the heart of “Selfless Excellence,” our core value we live every day.  We support our employees with great benefits like company paid medical/dental/vision/other insurance coverages for employees and dependents, equity in a late stage startup backed by top-tier VCs and paid holidays and time off.

With ThoughtSpot’s next-generation analytics platform, business people can use Google-like search to easily analyze complex, large-scale enterprise data and get trusted insights to questions they didn’t know to ask, automatically - all with a single click. ThoughtSpot’s customers include the world’s largest companies, such as Amway, BT, Bed Bath and Beyond, Chevron Federal Credit Union, De Beers, JD Sports, PetCo, ServiceNow, and Scotiabank.

ThoughtSpot is helmed by CEO Sudheesh Nair after being  co-founded in 2012 by Ajeet Singh and technical co-founders from Google, Microsoft, Amazon, and Oracle. jobs.title: Senior Financial Analyst, Corporate Finance
jobs.description:
**Are you looking to join one of the fastest growing software companies in the country? ThoughtSpot’s Search & AI-Driven analytics platform is disrupting the BI industry by making analytics 1000x faster and easier for non-technical business people.**

As a Corporate Finance Senior Financial Analyst at ThoughtSpot, you’ll be involved in planning, tracking and monitoring of the business across the various segments of the organization. Your focus will be primarily dedicated to corporate finance and the Research and Development (R&D) and General and Administrative (G&A) functions where your analysis will help support the FP&A team specific to engineering, product management, legal, human resources, among others. Your responsibilities will encompass assisting in the following key projects:

- Budget versus actual analysis of overall spending with the R&D and G&A functions
- Maintain financial model, forecast revenue and expense accounts, including participating in the monthly forecast planning process
- Assist with management and Board business and financial planning, including presentations and key analysis requests
- Collaborate with cross-functional teams to drive scalable analyses and insights
- Assist with ad hoc strategic and operational projects as required

**Required Skills/Qualifications:                     **

- 2+ years of experience in investment banking, management consulting, or high-growth technology company in a finance capacity
- Bachelor's degree in Finance, Accounting, Business Administration or related field
- Strong Microsoft Office skills (i.e. Excel, Word, PowerPoint), experience in Adaptive, NetSuite and Coupa are a plus
- Experience building and maintaining financial models and with corporate finance concepts
- Exceptional attention to detail and oral and written communication skills

jobs.title: Senior Manager, R&D Finance
jobs.description:
**Are you looking to join one of the fastest growing software companies in the Bay Area? ThoughtSpot’s Search & AI-Driven analytics platform is revolutionizing how the world uses data by making analytics 1000x faster and easier for non-technical business people.**

Our growing Finance team is looking for an experienced, strategic and hands-on Senior Manager to build out and run our Research and Development (R&D) finance function. This is a great opportunity to make a real difference at the ground level of a global, pre-IPO, tech company. Reporting to the VP of Finance and based at ThoughtSpot’s global headquarters in Sunnyvale, California, this newly-created position will play a critical role in supporting the Company’s continued track record of strong growth and driving a scalable and efficient operation. The person will embrace innovation, but with an eye to determining the ROI on projects and looking at the new product portfolio and balancing short-term and long-term projects, as well as supporting projects that will deliver revenue growth and products that enhance the existing platform and innovate into other areas. You will partner closely with the R&D teams to influence strategic decisions and maintain fiscal discipline.

The ideal candidate will have a background working with R&D leadership in the software industry and experience implementing best practices and best-of-breed tools/systems.

**Responsibilities:**

- Partner closely with Engineering, Product Management and Design leaders to define and drive responsibilities around forecasting and managing business metrics
- Drive annual planning and monthly forecasting for R&D and work with Corporate Finance in leading firm-wide financial planning 
- Provide recommendations to executive team and product leaders on actionable insights
- Own the communications strategy for R&D financial planning, including executive-level and detailed project briefs and status updates
- Leverage analytics for insights, highlighting trends and measuring the effectiveness of the product pipeline and portfolio
- Actively insure good economics for projects at the macro and micro levels and across both a short- and long-term horizon
- Collaborate with cross-functional leaders and teams including Accounting, Legal and Recruiting
- Attract, develop and retain outstanding talent

**Required Skills/Qualifications:**

- 7+ years of professional experience in high growth technology companies, preferably enterprise software, services or SaaS businesses
- Bachelor's degree in Finance, Accounting, Business Administration or related field; MBA a plus
- Understanding of high-tech landscape both from a business and technology perspective
- Advanced proficiency in financial analysis and financial modeling
- Strategic thinker with superior business acumen
- Skilled at building relationships and influencing at all levels of management and across functions
- Experience in R&D finance and comfortable communicating with R&D leaders
- Proficient in Adaptive Insights, NetSuite, Coupa and other software systems

**About ThoughtSpot**

At ThoughtSpot, we solve some of the hardest, most challenging problems in technology. The kind of problems we solve require diverse perspectives and the team-spirit to see those differences as opportunities rather than roadblocks.   • Actively insure good economics for projects at the macro and micro levels and across both a short- and long-term horizon
  • Collaborate with cross-functional leaders and teams including Accounting, Legal and Recruiting
  • Attract, develop and retain outstanding talent

Required Skills/Qualifications:

  • 7+ years of professional experience in high growth technology companies, preferably enterprise software, services or SaaS businesses
  • Bachelor's degree in Finance, Accounting, Business Administration or related field; MBA a plus
  • Understanding of high-tech landscape both from a business and technology perspective
  • Advanced proficiency in financial analysis and financial modeling
  • Strategic thinker with superior business acumen
  • Skilled at building relationships and influencing at all levels of management and across functions
  • Experience in R&D finance and comfortable communicating with R&D leaders
  • Proficient in Adaptive Insights, NetSuite, Coupa and other software systems

About ThoughtSpot

At ThoughtSpot, we solve some of the hardest, most challenging problems in technology. The kind of problems we solve require diverse perspectives and the team-spirit to see those differences as opportunities rather than roadblocks. It’s why diversity isn’t a box to check; it’s the heart of “Selfless Excellence,” our core value we live by every day. To make our dent in the universe, we seek employees with unique identities, backgrounds, and perspectives that want to build an inclusive, respectful company culture and truly challenge the status quo.

ThoughtSpot’s Search & AI-Driven analytics platform puts the power of a thousand analysts in every business person's hands. With ThoughtSpot’s next-generation analytics platform, business people can use Google-like search to easily analyze complex, large-scale enterprise data and get trusted insights to questions they didn’t know to ask, automatically - all with a single click. ThoughtSpot’s customers include the world’s largest companies, such as Amway, BT, Bed Bath and Beyond, Chevron Federal Credit Union, De Beers, JD Sports, ServiceNow, and Scotiabank.

ThoughtSpot is helmed by CEO Sudheesh Nair after being co-founded in 2012 by Ajeet Singh and technical co-founders from Google, Microsoft, Amazon, and Oracle. Backed by investors Lightspeed Venture Partners, Khosla Ventures, General Catalyst Partners, Geodesic Capital and Capital One Growth Ventures, ThoughtSpot has raised over $550 million to date at a unicorn valuation. Join us in our mission of enabling analytics "human scale" by putting search and AI-driven analytics in the hands of 20 million users by 2020.

jobs.title: Senior Technical Writer
jobs.description:
**ThoughtSpot is a fast-growing tech startup that’s disrupting the $190B analytics market with the world’s first Search and AI-driven analytics platform. The approach has been incredibly successful, helping us land $248M at a nearly $2B valuation, while customers like Walmart, Hulu, 7Eleven, and RollsRoyce continue to expand their investment in ThoughtSpot.**

**Senior Technical Writer:**

ThoughtSpot is growing by leaps and bounds, and so is our product. We are scaling our documentation team and processes to meet new opportunities and challenges. You are an exceptional technical writer and tools specialist. It’s not enough for you to write clear, world-class documentation. You are determined to improve each process, making everything better and faster. You know that content strategy is just the beginning. Content development, delivery, and accessibility are equally exciting and fun problems to solve. You are creative and innovative in the tools space, and always curious, eager, and able to pick up new technologies quickly.

**Responsibilities:**

- Help build out ThoughtSpot’s content stack, including customizing our authoring and production environments and tools.
- Bring the goodness of our documentation into our own products, to provide a seamless experience for our users.
- Help improve a large quantity of existing documentation for business users, data specialists, administrators, customer support, and partners.
- Develop tools to support our information architecture.
- Evaluate documentation technologies and methodologies, to innovate and make our information solutions world class.

**Required Skills/Qualifications:**

- Bachelor’s degree, or more, in Computer Science, Information Systems, Engineering, Technical Communications, English, or related disciplines.
- Solid, proven experience developing customer-facing enterprise software documentation.
- Know how to select and deploy great, modern documentation infrastructure.
- 2 years of experience in diverse environments developing, tooling, and deploying infrastructure projects for documentation teams.
- Hands-on experience building structured content management technologies, with DITA, Markdown, Javascript, HTML, Git, GitHub, BitBucket, Jekyll, Jenkins, CSS, CMS, static site generation, Web Hosting, and related technologies.
- You are technology-agnostic, and always look at the best possible way to achieve your objectives.
- You are intimately familiar with developing topic-based and structured content, understand information architecture principles and content organization, and write for a global audience by default.
- You have excellent writing skills that make information approachable for all clients: business users, data specialists, administrators, internal customer support, and partners. And you are highly motivated to deliver a top-notch customer experience.
- You enjoy partnering with designers, developers, product, support, and customer success to ensure that your documentation is correct, high quality, intuitive to follow, and simple to maintain.
- We prefer that you have domain expertise in Databases, Big Data, Search, and Business Intelligence, but it is not essential.

**About ThoughtSpot:**

We are an engineering-driven organization co-founded by engineers who built search and infrastructure systems at Google, database systems at Microsoft and enterprise software at Oracle. 

**More on ThoughtSpot:**

ThoughtSpot is helmed by CEO Sudheesh Nair after being  co-founded in 2012 by Ajeet Singh and technical co-founders from Google, Microsoft, Amazon, and Oracle. Backed by investors: Lightspeed Venture Partners, Khosla Ventures, General Catalyst Partners, Geodesic Capital, and Capital One Growth Ventures, ThoughtSpot has raised over $550 million to date at a unicorn valuation. Join us in our mission of enabling  analytics "human scale" by putting search and AI-driven Analytics in the hands of 20 million users by 2020.

**For more information please visit thoughtspot.com.**
